Austria.localInfoNoService: If you need to certify a copy of a UK passport for a United States tax return you can apply onlineto the British Embassy Vienna. At your appointment you'll need written confirmation that you're making a tax return in the US.
Austria.localInfo: The British Embassy Vienna can only certify a copy of a UK passport to be used for United States tax returns. At your appointment you'll need written confirmation that you're making a tax return in the US.

Albania.localRequirements:
Albanian authorities will ask for your birth certificate. This will be retained by the authorities so you should provide a [certified copy from a local notary](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/find-a-notary-abroad). If the authorities ask for your original birth certificate, explain that they are only issued once in the UK. You can use this [standard letter](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/668ea53e49b9c0597fdafa8f/Albania_-_standard_letter_-_birth_certificate.pdf) to help you.
Albanian authorities may ask you to provide a vërtetim banimi (proof of address template). If you live in the UK you can use this [standard letter](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/media/668ea57da3c2a28abb50cd58/Albania_-_standard_letter_-_proof_of_address.pdf) to help you explain that there’s no equivalent document in the UK.

Algeria.localRequirements: The Algerian government has issued guidance for [foreign nationals wishing to get married in Algeria](https://www.interieur.gov.dz/index.php/fr/%C3%A9trangers-en-alg%C3%A9rie/mariage-mixte/17-etranger-en-algerie.html). This is called a ‘mixed marriage‘ and there are [specific documents](https://www.interieur.gov.dz/index.php/fr/%C3%A9trangers-en-alg%C3%A9rie/mariage-mixte.html) you need to submit.

additionalDocs: Austrian residence certificate (‘Meldebestätigung’) with a registered ‘Hauptwohnsitz’ – if you or your partner live in Austria (this should also be your proof of address)
Austria.localRequirements: If you or your partner are legally resident in Austria, the proof of residence must be an Austrian residence certificate (‘Meldebestätigung’) with a registered ‘Hauptwohnsitz’.

Bolivia.localRequirements: You’ll also need to give the registrar in Bolivia a legalised (apostilled) birth certificate. You need to [apply for legalisation](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised) separately.

Bulgaria.postAddress:
British Embassy Sofia 
9, Moskovska St 
1000 Sofia 
Bulgaria
additionalDocs: either the proof of address or your partner‘s ID must prove that you or your partner live in Bulgaria or your partner is a Bulgarian national

Cambodia.localRequirements: The local commune (Sangkat) may be able to advise you on the documents you need to get married in Cambodia.

Central African Republic.post: the British Embassy Kinshasa (for Central African Republic)

Colombia.localRequirements: You may need to provide a legalised (apostilled) birth certificate translated into Spanish. You need to [apply for legalisation](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised) separately.

Croatia.postAddress:

Croatia
Croatia.localRequirements:
The CNI and the certificate of custom law will be issued in Croatian. You’ll need to get both certified by the Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs in Zagreb before they‘ll be accepted by your registrar.
You’ll also need to give the registrar a [legalised (apostilled)](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised) and [translated](https://find-a-professional-service-abroad.service.csd.fcdo.gov.uk/find/translators-interpreters) birth certificate. If your name is different on your birth certificate and your passport the local registrar will ask for evidence of your name change, for example deed poll or previous marriage certificate.

Egypt.localRequirements: Your proof that a previous marriage has ended, for example, your decree absolute or partner‘s death certificate, must be legalised by the country who issued it. For UK documents you need to [apply for legalisation](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised) separately.

El Salvador.post: the office of the Honorary Consul in San Salvador

additionalDocs: if you or your partner live in Estonia - you can use your extract from the [Estonian Population Register](https://www.eesti.ee/en/family/release-of-data-from-the-population-register/extract-from-the-population-register) as your proof of address

Finland.duration: around 3 months (check with local marriage authorities)
additionalDocs: residence permit card issued by Finnish Immigration Service (or equivalent for the country you live in) – this serves as your proof of address
partner‘s DVV certificate (this can also be their proof of address)

Honduras.post: the office of the Honorary Consul in Tegucigalpa

Italy
additionalDocs: partner‘s proof any previous marriages or civil partnerships have ended
proof of permanent address if you live outside of Italy
Italy.localRequirements: A CNI is equivalent to a ‘Nulla Osta’ in Italy.

Jordan.localRequirements:
The marital status affirmation you’ll swear will be slightly different depending on your type of marriage. 
For Islamic marriages at the Sharia Court, you’ll swear a single declaration document to prove you’re allowed to marry or a single divorced declaration document if you’re divorced.
For Christian marriages, you’ll swear a marital status affidavit.
Before your appointment, the British Embassy Amman will contact you to ask which document you need.

additionalDocs: letter from your employer or the local mayor that shows your address can also be used as proof of permanent address in Lebanon

Hong Kong.post: the British Consulate General Hong Kong (for Macao)

Montenegro.localRequirements: To get married in Montenegro you’ll need a certificate of no impediment (CNI) and a marital status affirmation, both issued by the British Embassy Podgorica. Your online application includes both documents.

additionalDocs: proof you live in Norway (this should also be your proof of address)
Norway.localRequirements: Appointments are only available at the British Embassy Oslo. You’ll need to travel to Oslo for your appointment.

Peru.localRequirements: You’ll also need to provide your legalised (apostilled) birth certificate. You need to [apply for legalisation](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised) separately. Any other documents requested by the authorities that were issued outside of Peru will also need to be legalised and translated before they‘ll be accepted.

ul. Kawalerii 12

Mazowieckie

Philippines.localRequirements: Once you‘ve applied online, print out either an [affirmation](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/philippines-affirmation-and-affidavit-forms) (if you want to make a non-religious declaration) or [affidavit](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/philippines-affirmation-and-affidavit-forms) (religious). Fill in your details by hand but do not sign yet. You must bring your completed form with you to your appointment at your embassy or consulate and sign it then.

Spain.duration: 3 or 6 months (check with the person conducting your ceremony)
additionalDocs: partner‘s proof any previous marriages or civil partnerships have ended
if you live in Spain, use your registration certificate for the town hall register (padrón municipal) as proof of address
Spain.localRequirements:
You must apply for your documents 3 months before your civil registry appointment, or your wedding date if you’re holding a religious ceremony first and registering the marriage at the civil registry afterwards.
Once the British Consulate General Madrid gets your correct documents in the post, you should get your documents within 30 working days. Your application cannot be processed any faster, even if your civil registry appointment or wedding date is closer. 
The British Consulate General Madrid is unable to provide updates on the status of your application.

additionalDocs: partner‘s extract from the population register (if they‘re registered in Sweden)

Brazil.duration: 3 months (check with the notarial office before applying)

additionalDocs: partner‘s proof any previous marriages or civil partnerships have ended

Indonesia.duration: 3 months (you should confirm this with the local authority)

Macao.localRequirements: There’s no British embassy or consulate to get documents to prove you’re eligible to marry in Macao. You’ll need to travel to the British Consulate General Hong Kong for your appointment to get a marital status affirmation.

Russia.duration: 3 to 12 months (check with the person conducting your ceremony)
additionalDocs: a piece of paper with the Russian spelling of your full name as you want it to appear on your CNI (it needs to be consistent across all the documents you submit to the Russian authorities)
if you’re planning a religious ceremony and you’re not a resident in UAE you’ll need to provide your partner‘s proof of UAE residency
letter from your employer or the local mayor that shows your address can also be used as proof of permanent address in UAE
United Arab Emirates.localRequirements: Once you‘ve applied online, download either the [affirmation](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/affidavitaffirmatin-of-marital-status-forms-uae) (if you want to make a non-religious declaration) or [affidavit](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/affidavitaffirmatin-of-marital-status-forms-uae) (religious) and type in your details. Do not fill in by hand or sign it. Email a copy of your form to either [British Embassy Dubai](mailto:consularappointment.uae@fcdo.gov.uk) or [British Embassy Abu Dhabi](mailto:abudhabi.consularappointments@fcdo.gov.uk). They will process your application and confirm your appointment. If you do not email a copy of the completed template your appointment will be cancelled.

Vietnam.duration: 3 or 6 months (check with the local People‘s Committee)
Vietnam.localRequirements: Your proof that a previous marriage has ended, for example, your decree absolute or partner‘s death certificate, must be legalised if they were issued in the UK. You need to [apply for legalisation](https://www.gov.uk/get-document-legalised) separately.

India.delivery: You will be notified when you need to arrange for your document to be collected by a prepaid courier during high commission or office opening hours
India.customText: Your sworn statement must be on stamped paper. Speak to your lawyer about this.

Spain.delivery: Your document will be posted to your chosen address in Spain. You'll be charged an additional £13 for postage.

Thailand.delivery: Your document will be posted to your chosen address in Thailand. You'll be charged an additional £2 for postage.

United Arab Emirates.delivery: Book an appointment at the British Embassy Abu Dhabi or Dubai to collect your document.

Vietnam.delivery: Book an appointment at the British Embassy Hanoi or the British Consulate General Ho Chi Minh City to collect your document.

Mexico - criminal record certificate let.name: letter for a registration data or criminal record certificate
Mexico - criminal record certificate let.customText: To get a criminal record certificate you’ll need a letter from the British Embassy Mexico City requesting a criminal background check from Mexican authorities. The Mexican authorities are responsible for the process – the embassy cannot provide the certificate directly.

Democratic Republic of the Congo - consu.name: consular certificate (attestation consulaire)
Democratic Republic of the Congo - consu.customText: You might need a consular certificate so that you can work or renew your residency permit in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

India - organ transplant letter.name: organ transplant letter
India - organ transplant letter.customText:
British high commissions in India can:

  • stamp and sign the Form 21 that you get from the hospital
  • give you a stamped and signed letter that says they cannot verify your relationship with the donor to issue a no objection certificate

They cannot:

  • certify a copy of your passport – you should find a local notary to do this
  • issue a no objection to organ donation certificate

You’ll need to bring the original Form 21 to an appointment at the British high commission.

India - letter to access Indian state or.name: letter to access Indian state or national archives
India - letter to access Indian state or.delivery: Arrange for your document to be collected by a prepaid courier during high commission or office opening hours.
India - letter to access Indian state or.additionalEvidence: • letter from the college, university or institution saying what your research is

India - letter of introduction for admis.name: letter of introduction for admission to an Indian university
India - letter of introduction for admis.delivery: Arrange for your document to be collected by a prepaid courier during high commission or office opening hours.

Panama - certificate of entitlement for.name: certificate of entitlement for a Panamanian driving licence
Panama - certificate of entitlement for.customText:
You’ll need a DVLA ‘check code’ to share with the British Embassy Panama City. They’ll use the information to check your UK driving licence.

To get a check code:

  1. Go to DVLA to view your driving licence information – you’ll need to enter your driving licence number, National Insurance number and postcode.
  2. Click on the ‘get your check code’ tab.
  3. Select ‘print’ or ‘print or save’ (this may be different depending on which device you’re using).
  4. Download a DVLA licence summary – you’ll need the first page of the summary for this service, which includes the code and last 8 numbers of your driving licence number

The check code is valid for 21 days and can only be used once, so get the code when you’re ready to apply and do not use it anywhere else.

Thailand - letter supporting Thai citize.name: letter supporting Thai citizenship
Thailand - letter supporting Thai citize.customText:
The law in Thailand needs you to give up (renounce) any existing citizenship to get Thai citizenship. You do not have to do this if you're a woman married to a Thai national.

Find out how to give up your British citizenship.

You'll need to get a certified copy of your passport from the embassy, which costs an additional £25. Send your UK passport to the embassy after you've applied online.
Thailand - letter supporting Thai citize.delivery: Your document will be posted to your chosen address in Thailand. You'll be charged an additional £2 for postage.
Thailand - letter supporting Thai citize.postAddress:
Consular Services
British Embassy Bangkok
AIA Sathorn Tower
Floor 12A
11/1 South Sathorn Road
Sathorn
Bangkok
10120

USA - J1 visa no objection statement.name: J1 visa no objection statement
USA - J1 visa no objection statement.customText:
To apply for a no objection statement to get a waiver of the 2-year home residency requirement you’ll need to:

  • complete form DS-3035 from the US Department of State
  • get a waiver case number and third party barcode page
USA - J1 visa no objection statement.additionalEvidence:
• completed application pack
  • waiver case number and third party barcode page
USA - J1 visa no objection statement.delivery: You'll receive confirmation in 2 to 3 working days that the no objection statement has been sent to the US Department of State.

Belgium - certificate of custom law.additionalEvidence:
• your partner's passport
  • your full birth certificate (this includes parents’ details)
  • proof any previous marriage or civil partnerships have ended
Belgium - certificate of custom law.delivery: Your document will be posted to your chosen address in Belgium. You'll be charged an additional £5 for postage.

Andorra - MSC.name: marital status certificate (MSC) for marriage, civil partnership or cohabitation
Andorra - MSC.additionalEvidence:
• your partner's passport
  • your full birth certificate (this includes parents’ details)
  • proof of your address in Andorra, for example, your residence certificate or 'certificat d’empadronament'
  • proof any previous marriage or civil partnership has ended, for example, a decree absolute, annulment certificate or death certificate
Andorra - MSC.customText:
You’ll need an appointment at the British Consulate General Barcelona to make an affirmation of your marital status and collect your certificate. Your MSC will cost £100 – £50 to make the affirmation and £50 to issue the certificate.

You can only get an MSC to register a cohabitation arrangement (unió estable de parella) if you live in Andorra.
Andorra - MSC.post: the British Consulate General Barcelona (for Andorra)

Vietnam - letter to support a permanent.name: letter to support a permanent residency application
Vietnam - letter to support a permanent.customText:
At your appointment you will need to bring:

  • your Vietnamese spouses's passport
  • your proof of address
